text: Olivia Munn has insisted she will continue to speak up for the # MeToo movement, even if it'costs her her career '. The actress, 38, made the statement in an interview for Cosmopolitan's December issue, as she called for a change in Hollywood to abolish the'unfair stigma'surrounding women. It comes after she fought to have her former co - star Steven Wilder Striegel - a registered sex offender - removed from new movie The Predator and bravely spoke out about disgraced director Brett Ratner, accusing him of sexual harassment.
